intro: Triteleia patagonica var. angustiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf triteleia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern South America. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
